zoomLevelDescriptions.90: Slightly zoomed out to fit more content on screen.
zoomLevelDescriptions.110: Zoom in a little for easier reading.

general.restartRequired: You will need to restart ANYON for your settings to take effect.
general.releaseChannelDescription: Choose which version updates to receive.
general.releaseChannelStableNote: Stable is recommended for most users.
general.releaseChannelBetaNote: Beta receives more frequent updates but may have more bugs.

stable.title: Using Stable release channel
stable.description: You'll stay on your current version until a newer stable release is available, or you can manually downgrade now.

beta.title: Using Beta release channel
beta.description: You will need to restart ANYON for your settings to take effect.

general.runtimeModeDescription: Choose whether to run apps directly on the local machine or in Docker containers.

nodePath.title: Node.js path configuration
nodePath.configured: Node.js is properly configured and ready to use.
nodePath.help: Select the folder where Node.js is installed if it's not in your system PATH.
nodePath.notFoundAtPath: Could not find Node.js at the path '{{path}}'

workflow.autoApproveDisableHint: Auto-approve enabled. You'll stop seeing approval prompts for AI changes.
workflow.autoFixDisableHint: Auto-fix enabled. ANYON will automatically attempt to fix detected problems.
workflow.autoExpandPreviewDescription: Automatically expand the preview panel when content is available.
workflow.chatCompletionNotificationDescription: Show a native notification when a chat response completes while the app is not focused.

ai.modelDescription: Select the AI model to use.
ai.maxChatTurnsDescription: Maximum number of conversation turns in context.
ai.maxChatTurnsLabel: Maximum number of chat turns used in context

maxChatTurnsDescriptions.economy: Minimal context to reduce token usage and improve response times.
maxChatTurnsDescriptions.default: Balanced context size for most conversations.
maxChatTurnsDescriptions.plus: Slightly higher context size for detailed conversations.
maxChatTurnsDescriptions.high: Extended context for complex conversations requiring more history.
maxChatTurnsDescriptions.max: Maximum context (not recommended due to cost and speed).

thinkingBudgetDescriptions.low: Minimal thinking tokens for faster responses and lower costs.
thinkingBudgetDescriptions.high: Extended thinking for complex problems requiring deep analysis.

ai.defaultChatModeDescription: The chat mode used when creating new chats.

openCodeConnection.label: OpenCode connection

descriptions.proxy: Route AI requests through ANYON proxy server (requires ANYON Pro subscription).
descriptions.direct: Use your own OpenCode/Claude subscription directly (for development).

openCodeConnection.directWarning: Direct mode uses your personal OpenCode configuration. Make sure you have a valid Claude/OpenCode subscription.

telemetry.title: Telemetry
telemetry.description: Help us improve by sending anonymous usage data.

azure.enterApiKey: Enter your Azure OpenAI API key
azure.configuredDescription: ANYON will use the credentials saved in Settings for Azure OpenAI models.
azure.envVarsDescription: AZURE_API_KEY and AZURE_RESOURCE_NAME are set. Values saved below will override them.
azure.requiredDescription: Provide your Azure resource name and API key below, or configure the AZURE_API_KEY and AZURE_RESOURCE_NAME environment variables.
azure.apiKeyPlaceholder: Enter your Azure OpenAI API key
azure.configurationDescription: Azure OpenAI requests require both a resource name and API key. Enter them above or supply the environment variables instead.
azure.envVarsContinue: You can continue to configure Azure via environment variables. If both variables are present and no settings are saved, ANYON will use them automatically.
azure.envVarsOverride: Values saved in Settings take precedence over environment variables. Restart ANYON after changing environment variables.

vertex.pasteServiceKey: Paste the full JSON contents of your service account key here
vertex.locationDescription: If you see a "model not found" error, try a different region. Some partner models (MaaS) are only available in specific locations (e.g., us-central1, us-west2).
vertex.serviceAccountKeyPlaceholder: Paste the full JSON contents of your service account key here
vertex.configurationDescription: Provide Project, Location, and a service account JSON key with Vertex AI access.

providers.envKeyIsActive: This key is currently active (no settings key set).
providers.envKeyOverridden: This key is currently being overridden by the key set in Settings.
providers.envVarNotSetMessage: The {{name}} environment variable is not set.
providers.envKeyInfo: This key is set outside the application. If present, it will be used only if no key is configured in the Settings section above. Requires app restart to detect changes.
providers.settingKeyWillOverride: Setting a key here will override the environment variable (if set).
providers.notFoundDescription: The provider with ID "{{provider}}" could not be found.

experiments.nativeGitDescription: This doesn't require any external Git installation and offers a faster, native-Git performance experience.

dangerZone.title: Danger Zone
dangerZone.deleteDataDescription: This will permanently delete all your apps and settings.
dangerZone.deleteDataConfirm: Are you sure? This action cannot be undone.
dangerZone.resetSuccess: Successfully reset everything. Restart the application.
